textos_fuente.text: Contact Us - Bedrock Sandals Free US Shipping + Free US Returns / Exchanges Free US Shipping + Free US Returns / Exchanges Shop Now Best Sellers Shop Our Story Blog Contact More Search Login 0 Cart Best Sellers Shop Our Story Blog Contact More Login Search 0 Cart All Footwear Shop all Bedrock Award-Winning footwear from our sandal to clog. Mountain Clogs An actual all-terrain clog? Yeah, we did that. Our new Mountain Clog has your toes covered all year long. All Sandals From ridge to river, our Cairn Evo is the modern adventure sandal. Apparel Gear up with everything from our original split-toe socks to multi-functional headwear. Model Compare Compare our different footwear models to find your best fit. Bedrock the problem mission partners leadership Safety and belonging for all Bedrock supports the institutions and leaders working to prevent hate-fueled violence in America Learn More The United States has experienced a rapid, significant increase in Hate-Fueled Violence (HFV) Hate crimes, political violence, mass violence and terrorism, and violence targeting marginalized populations are all historically high. Reported hate crimes are at all-time highs across the country â Political violence has reached its highest level in half a century â Our polling found that seven out of ten Americans feel personally affected by HFV Our goal is to supercharge the field of HFV prevention Partner Partner Facilitate Communicate Innovate Partners â¼ Partner Engage current and welcome new HFV prevention stakeholders to the table Unite together target communities, hate-fueled violence preventers, and other key stakeholders to coordinate and empower their efforts on a national scale. Facilitate Facilitate shared understanding of HFV challenges and prevention methods Map views of HFV prevention, and assess the landscape of options to address the challenge. Communicate Empower joint communications Support a messaging ecosystem that better facilitates belonging and blunts the influence of messages that spread hate. Innovate Catalyze innovative projects to address hate-animating narratives Serve as partnership convener, strategist, and facilitator for innovative projects that further the norms of inclusion. Ford Presidential Foundation Susan Rice Former Director, White House Domestic Policy Council Harman Singh Co-Interim Executive Director, Sikh Coalition Amy Spitalnick CEO, Jewish Council for Public Affairs Jim Wallis Chair and Founding Director, Georgetown Center for Faith and Justice Peter Wehner Senior Fellow, The Trinity Forum John Yang President and Executive Director, AAJC Board and Organizational Leadership Melody Barnes Board Member. Former Director, White House Domestic Policy Council, Obama Administration John Bridgeland Board Co-Chair. Should we partner? Do you have a question? Contact us at info@bedrock.us. Press inquiries press@bedrock.us Bedrock is a non-partisan, not-for-profit initiative

Network - Bedrock Group Approach Services Network Perspectives Client Login Get Access Keeping Your Circle Small and Your Horizons Wide. As a Bedrock client, you’ll not only work directly with our partners, but through our network you’ll have access to some of the sharpest minds in the business and unique investment opportunities. Foundation UBS Team All, Founders, Partners, Senior Leaders, Extended Team, Advisors and Non-Executive Board Ariel Arazi Managing Partner & Co-Founder Ariel Arazi Managing Partner & Co-Founder Having started his career in 1993 with the Republic National Bank of New York in Switzerland as a proprietary trader, Ariel went on to join the bank’s treasury team to co-manage – alongside David – a portfolio of Fixed Income, FX and Emerging Market debt of more than USD 10 billion. Subsequently, from 2000 to 2004, Ariel went on to work with the Safra Family Office in Geneva where he co-managed – alongside David – the financial assets and the foundation of the Safra family. Ariel holds a BSc in Business and Economics from the University of Geneva. David Joory Managing Partner & Co-Founder David Joory Managing Partner & Co-Founder David started his career in 1988 with the Republic National Bank of New York as an FX trader. In 1993 he moved to the treasury department, where he co-managed – together with Ariel – the proprietary positions of the group’s European arm, Safra Republic Holdings, directly alongside the Chairman, Edmond J. Safra. From 2000 to 2004, David was with the Safra Family Office in Geneva, where he was responsible for managing the assets of the Edmond J. Safra Philanthropic Foundation as well as the Safra family’s financial assets. David holds a BSc in Business and Economics from the University of Geneva and is a board member of the Alliance of Swiss Wealth Managers (ASWM). Maurice Ephrati Managing Partner & Co-Founder Maurice Ephrati Managing Partner & Co-Founder Maurice was a practicing business lawyer in Geneva before going on to become a director at an international commodities trading company. Subsequently, Maurice joined Union Bancaire Privée in Geneva as a senior member of management, in charge of several private banking divisions as well as the Family Office Operation. From 2000 to 2004, Maurice served on the Private Banking Executive Board of Banque Privée Edmond de Rothschild in Geneva. Maurice graduated with honours from law school in 1988 and passed the Bar exam with honours in 1990. He has also completed programs in Finance at INSEAD in 1994, and in Financial Asset Management & Engineering (FAME) at HEC, Lausanne in 1997. Alex Perowne Partner – Head of Fixed Income – Investment Office Alex Perowne Partner – Head of Fixed Income – Investment Office Alex joined Bedrock in July 2015 and is part of the Portfolio Management team in London, with a particular focus on Fixed Income.  Prior to joining Bedrock, Alex was Head of Fixed Income for a family office in London and previously spent eight years working for Deutsche Bank as a Relationship Manager and Investment Manager in both London and Geneva. Alex graduated from Durham University with a BA in Economics in 2004 and is a CFA charter holder. Alexander Berman Partner – Wealth Management Alexander Berman Partner – Wealth Management Alex joined Bedrock in Geneva in 2012 from Banque Reyl where he worked on the Russian/Israeli desk.  Prior to this, Alex worked at Banque Safdie and Bank Leumi in Geneva and Tel Aviv, where he managed portfolios and advised high net worth private and corporate clients since 2001.  Alex started his career as a specialist in foreign securities and options strategies in Israel. Alex has an MBA in Finance, as well as a BA in Finance & Economics from the Open University, Israel. Carlota van de Koppel Partner –  Chief Operating Officer – Executive Office Carlota van de Koppel Partner –  Chief Operating Officer – Executive Office Carlota joined Bedrock in 2016 and is currently the Chief Operating Officer; acting as a trusted sounding board for the executive team on a range of operational and strategic business matters. Prior to Bedrock, she pursued an online entrepreneurial venture in Madrid as well as gained experience in the consulting and finance sectors in NYC and London. Carlota completed a BSc in Business Management at King’s College London and a MSc in Management, Organizations, and Governance at the London School of Economics. Linguistically, she is fluent in Spanish, English, and Dutch. Consistently seeking to engage with the wider context of the business’ operations, she is passionate about CSR and has a strong commitment to Next Gen initiatives that promote educational networking opportunities. Jihad Tabbara Partner – Wealth Management Jihad Tabbara Partner – Wealth Management As a Partner of Wealth Management at Bedrock, Jihad previously led the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) platform at HSBC Private Bank Monaco after a noteworthy role at Republic National Bank of New York. During his time at Republic, he played a pivotal role in establishing the equity and Bond trading desk, forging connections with Bedrock’s team like Ariel, David, and Sandy. Jihad’s educational background includes a degree in Civil Engineering from Rice University in Houston and a Masters in Structural Design from Columbia University in New York. Keyvan Khosrovshahi Partner – Group Head of Legal, Risk & Compliance Keyvan Khosrovshahi Partner – Group Head of Legal, Risk & Compliance Keyvan joined Bedrock in 2005 from a private equity company where he was a partner between 2000 and 2005.  Keyvan was responsible for investment management with an emphasis on an internet BtoB platform.  Prior to that, Keyvan was an internal audit associate for Union Bancaire Privée in Geneva, where he managed the team auditing the Private Banking, Trading and FX desks, as well as the asset management department for the various offices (Geneva, London, New York, Nassau).  Keyvan was strongly involved in all compliance and procedure issues for both firms. Keyvan is a graduate of the Geneva Law School. Raquel Santos Silva Partner – Wealth Management Raquel Santos Silva Partner – Wealth Management Joining Bedrock’s Wealth Management division in 2021 as a Director, Raquel began in Investment Banking at Morgan Stanley and Santander before pursuing an MBA at Columbia University. With experience in investment banking and management, she’s guided affluent families and entrepreneurs in creating enduring asset allocation strategies for both public and private market investments. With over 12 years dedicated to wealth management, she enriched her experience at Goldman Sachs and Pictet in London, while also sharing her insights as a guest lecturer at Universidade Catolica Portuguesa and INSEAD. Beyond Bedrock, Raquel finds fulfilment in teaching. Robert Mizrahi Partner – Wealth Management Robert Mizrahi Partner – Wealth Management Robert joined Bedrock in 2008, following a career as an investment banker. Today, as a Partner in Wealth Management, he brings an impressive 30-year background in finance to the table. Robert’s success at Bedrock can be attributed to his skill in fostering trust and enduring personal relationships. His experience spans from UBS and Aareal Bank to Commerzbank in London, with a focus on debt capital markets originating Eurobonds and structuring mortgage-backed securities. Robert holds an MSc in Engineering from Imperial College, London and his personal interests revolve around classic cars and exploring the world through culture-led travel experiences. Roberto Neumann Partner – Wealth Management Roberto Neumann Partner – Wealth Management Roberto joined Bedrock in 2011 as a Partner in Wealth Management from Safdié Bank Geneva, where he helmed Latin America Private Banking as Head of Brazil and Portugal Team. Roberto’s prior role as Director of the Multi Commercial Bank in the Brazilian headquarters of Safdié group in São Paulo,  as well as his time at Safra Bank -SP, means that he’s brought with him a rich 35-year financial market journey. Roberto now focuses on robust client relationships and a global outlook at Bedrock. Beyond finance, he finds joy in family travels, swimming, music, and soccer. Alexandra Blechschmidt-Marmion Portfolio Management Director – Investment Office Alexandra Blechschmidt-Marmion Portfolio Management Director – Investment Office Alexandra joined Bedrock in 2006.  From 2001, Alexandra was with the Edouard Stern Family Office in Geneva where she was responsible for managing the treasury and trading activities and where she was also the Geneva Branch Administrator.  Prior to this, Alexandra worked for Republic National Bank as an FX Trader where she worked with David and Ariel.  Alexandra started her career in 1995 in Paris as an interests rates options broker. Alexandra graduated with honours from law school in 1993 and has also completed a postgraduate program from MATIF School in Paris. Ben Hancock Senior Vice-President, Research – Investment Office Ben Hancock Senior Vice-President, Research – Investment Office Corinne Sirvent Brun Senior Vice-President – Wealth Management Corinne Sirvent Brun Senior Vice-President – Wealth Management Following leadership roles at BNP Paribas Wealth Management, where she was in charge of the Middle East and North Africa, Turkey and C.I.S. area as Investment Solutions Manager, and HSBC Private Bank Monaco, Corinne’s competitive spirit now compliments her role as Senior Vice-Present of Wealth Management at Bedrock. Graduating from the University of Bordeaux Montaigne with a Master’s degree in Business, Finance & International Trade, she now caters to an international clientele. Beyond Bedrock, she has a passion for sports, particularly horse riding, and a keen interest in literature, cinema, and travel. Eric Micheloud Head of Private Office, Director – Administration & Finance Eric Micheloud Head of Private Office, Director – Administration & Finance Eric joined Bedrock in 2015 from the private banking and asset management industry where he was the managing director in Financial, Operational and Family Office sectors.  Eric also spent 7 years within the Exane Group,  supervising overall operations in Switzerland, Germany and Italy.  Prior to joining the Finance industry, Eric spent several years in the commodities trading industry mainly in business development in Asia and Latin America. Eric graduated in Economy and Business Administration from the University of Applied Sciences in Western Switzerland, Neuchâtel and has also completed a postgraduate program in Finance at INSEAD. Eyal Hanouna Head of Investments, Director – Investment Office Eyal Hanouna Head of Investments, Director – Investment Office Eyal Hanouna is the Head of Investments at Bedrock. He has more than 18 years of experience in asset allocation, global macro trading, quantitative portfolio management, and risk management. Before joining Bedrock in November 2022, he co-managed a multi-strategy quantitative macro fund at PAG, overseeing trading, alpha signal development, and risk management. Previously, Eyal spent 11 years at Pictet Wealth Management, co-managing a systematic global asset allocation mandate with over $700 million in AUM. Eyal holds a degree in Economics from the University of Geneva and a Master’s in Finance from the Universities of Lausanne, Neuchatel and Geneva. He is a CFA, FRM and CAIA charterholder. Helena Eaton Investment Advisor, Senior Vice-President – Investment Office Helena Eaton Investment Advisor, Senior Vice-President – Investment Office Helena joined Bedrock Group in 2023 as an Investment Advisor from J.P. Morgan Private Bank, where she spent six years advising ultra-high-net-worth clients. Before J.P. Morgan, Helena worked as an investment advisor to private clients at Citi. Her extensive experience also includes roles at Deloitte, UNDP, and a senior lecturer position at Regents University in London. Helena holds an MBA from London Business School, was a Fulbright Scholar at Columbia University in New York, and earned a PhD in Economics. She is a CFA Charterholder and Chartered FCSI. Additionally, Helena volunteers for the CFA Institute as an author and curriculum reviewer in the Private Wealth Management pathway. Kate Hobson Chief Marketing Officer – Executive Office Kate Hobson Chief Marketing Officer – Executive Office Kate joined Bedrock in 2018. Prior to this, she worked for a digital marketing agency, fintech proposition and a well-established international wealth manager based in Mayfair. Kate holds a BSc in Economics and Social Sciences from Manchester University and an LLB in Law from the University of Law. At Bedrock, she currently acts as Chief Marketing Officer and is strongly focused on harnessing emerging digital technologies to improve customer-facing processes and activities. Louise Wachtmeister Vice-President – Wealth Management Louise Wachtmeister Vice-President – Wealth Management Louise began at Bedrock in 2013 after her role as Senior Vice President at VistaJet, a private aviation company, where she drove sales across crucial Scandinavian and Eastern European markets. Now Vice-President of Wealth Management, she uses her experience as a Senior Consultant to find solutions for her clients. Armed with a BA in Business and Economics from Stockholm University, Louise’s personal passions include music and travel. Maria Dos Santos Senior Vice-President, Client Support – Wealth Management Maria Dos Santos Senior Vice-President, Client Support – Wealth Management Maria Villax Head of Family Strategy and Governance, Senior Vice-President – Wealth Management Maria Villax Head of Family Strategy and Governance, Senior Vice-President – Wealth Management Maria assists families in building structures that bridge their values with their assets. She’s a driving force behind Next Generation Education initiatives, fostering responsible ownership for the future. Beginning as a lawyer in Lisbon specialising in criminal litigation and intellectual property, Maria later pursued an MBA in London. She transitioned through the fashion industry and spent five years with a Big4 Firm advising family businesses and offices on effective governance practices. Being a third-generation member of a family business herself, Maria is deeply committed to helping families prepare for lasting success. She finds joy in horse riding, skiing, and windsurfing, as well as fashion and travel. Mitchel Bishop Senior Vice-President – Back Office Mitchel Bishop Senior Vice-President – Back Office Nael Moudarres Head of IT Support Nael Moudarres Head of IT Support Neil Benjelloun Head of Private Markets, Senior Vice-President – Investment Office Neil Benjelloun Head of Private Markets, Senior Vice-President – Investment Office Rhea Tabbara Associate – Wealth Management Rhea Tabbara Associate – Wealth Management With an M.A in International Relations and Mathematics from the University of St Andrews, Rhea started her career in PR & marketing at Alexander McQueen in London, making her way into FinTech with Carlo in Monaco and eventually settling in her role at Bedrock in 2022. As she supports clients in the generational transition and transfer of responsibility on to the next wave of leadership, Rhea is always seeking to connect with like-minded peers who share a similar trajectory and are eager to learn more about what we do. Firmly believing that one’s network can create opportunities for individuals to reach their goal, she seeks to raise awareness around exclusive opportunities with our families, paving the way for a future of meaningful collaboration and innovation. Richard Rimer Chief Executive Officer – Technology Opportunity Partners Richard Rimer Chief Executive Officer – Technology Opportunity Partners Richard joined Bedrock in 2013 to create a Fund to invest in iconic, blue-chip, private, internet-related companies. In 2018, he and his team created a sister fund to allocate capital to best-in-class venture GPs. Since launching Technology Opportunity Partners, Richard has had primary responsibility for deploying c. $1B of equity in the private tech space. Before joining Bedrock, Richard was an active direct investor in both early- and late-stage technology businesses. Richard joined Index Ventures in 2001 where he was a partner in the life science practice. Prior to Index, Richard built Europe’s largest specialty pharmacy – MediService – which was acquired by Galenica (GALE.SW) and has become a pillar of its retail business. From 1990 to 1993 Richard worked in Zurich for McKinsey & Co. He graduated from Stanford University with B.A.’s in Economics, and History and an MA in International Policy Studies. Robyn Jones Head of Human Resources Robyn Jones Head of Human Resources Ron Mosseri Senior Vice-President – Wealth Management Ron Mosseri Senior Vice-President – Wealth Management Ron has more than 15 years’ experience of advising private clients and managing their investment portfolios. He joined Bedrock in 2019, following a decade at the Israeli desks of Barclays Private Bank and Edmond de Rothschild in London. Relocating from London to Bedrock’s Monaco office, Ron brought with him a wealth of experience in supporting Israeli residents as well as UK resident-non-domiciled clients. Ron’s strong ties to his native Israeli tech scene have expanded Bedrock’s network and expertise in this field. He holds a BA in Economics from Rutgers University and is fluent in English, French, Italian, and Hebrew. Dedicated to the future of Detroit and Cleveland. We see cities as more than just physical structures. They represent endless opportunities. Our Story We believe in the power of place. No one is born knowing the impact of place. But we are all influenced by it. Streets, buildings, neighborhoodsâthey shape our experiences, connecting us to each other and our community. Our Portfolio Committed to the communities we call home. We build to enhance the rhythm of our cities and the rhyme of our culture. We construct new spaces that positively impact today and endure tomorrow. Our Values The tenants turning spaces into destinations. Our retail tenants do more than occupy space. They serve as anchors that activate street corners, draw people in and help create the energy that fuels local life. We drive this impact by curating a dynamic tenant mix, crafting tailored spaces and building lasting partnerships. By strategically placing tenants and actively supporting their growth, we transform properties into sought after destinations. Join the Bedrock Communities team as an Accounts Payable Clerk!

Company Overview: 
Bedrock Communities (“Bedrock”) is a real estate private equity firm with offices in Westport Connecticut and Tampa… | Bedrock Communities Agree & Join LinkedIn By clicking Continue to join or sign in, you agree to LinkedIn’s User Agreement , Privacy Policy , and Cookie Policy . Skip to main content LinkedIn Top Content People Learning Jobs Games Join now Sign in Bedrock Communities’ Post Bedrock Communities 1,736 followers 1y Report this post Join the Bedrock Communities team as an Accounts Payable Clerk!

Company Overview: 
Bedrock Communities (“Bedrock”) is a real estate private equity firm with offices in Westport Connecticut and Tampa Florida, that focuses on the manufactured housing industry. Currently, Bedrock owns and manages approximately 4,000 units in primarily in Florida. Bedrock Communities has raised approximately $200 million in equity, across three funds, to invest in the manufactured housing sector and currently manages a portfolio valued at over $450 million.
 
About the position:
Bedrock is seeking a full-time Accounts Payable Clerk who is a proactive and detail-oriented individual to be a part of a dynamic and growing company. This role will report directly to the Accounts Payable Associate and the CFO. 
 
Responsibilities:
- Receive, process, assign, verify, and reconcile invoices
- Communicate with property utility companies during the property onboarding process
- Review expense reports for all firm employees
- Assist with all month-end close procedures for each property
- Preparation and analysis of property cash flows
 
Requirements and Qualifications:
- Prior experience in accounts payable and a basic knowledge of accounting.
- Must be a self-starter and ready to work hard in a small, entrepreneurial environment.
- Proficiency with Excel
- Real Estate property management experience and/or experience using QuickBooks, Concur, or Yardi is a plus but not required.
- Ability to work autonomously, be proactive, multi-task, and work collaboratively across departments.
- Demonstrated ability to preserve confidentiality of information.
 
If you are detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy, apply now to join our dynamic team. 

For further consideration, please send a cover letter and resume to recruiting@bedrock-communities.com . FORMS REQUIRED FOR ALL APPLICANTS: After completing the form at right, a member of our team will reach out to assist with submitting your required documents. In the meantime, please review and gather all items listed below: Valid Form of Identification – acceptable forms include: State Issued Driver’s License Passport Military Identification State Issued Identification Card Proof of Income – acceptable documents include: Standard W-2 Employees – Last two months of paystubs or a fully executed offer of employment letter on original company letterhead Self-employed – Last two year’s filed tax returns Independent Contractor – Most recent 1099(s) plus last two months of payment proof Retirement, SSI, Disability, Unemployment, Vouchers – Award letter or last two bank statements with consistent source identified auto-deposits Child Support and/or Alimony – Divorce Decree or Court Order and two months of payment proof Rental Income – Most recent tax return showing reported income or an executed lease agreement and two months of payment proof Cash Income – Three months worth of bank statements showing recurring deposits The Minimum Income Requirement is 2.5 x the Monthly Home or Lot Rent Amount 2 Months of Verifiable Income Must be Supplied Completed Residency Application – Provided by Bedrock Communities All occupants 18 or older must complete their own application, which will be provided by the community We are unable to accept applications in the name of business entity Application Fee – $50 Per Applicant Check, money order, or cashier’s check must be made payable to the community that you are applying to Please submit your information and a member of our team will be in touch with you soon! Bedrock TX Website Skip to content Home About Bedrock About Careers Services HOA Management Closing Docs Contact Home About Bedrock About Careers Services HOA Management Closing Docs Contact Dedicated to Exceptional Community Management At Bedrock Association Management, we provide tailored solutions to ensure your community thrives. From financial services to day-to-day operations, we make management seamless and stress-free. Request a Proposal Accurate Financial Management You Can Trust Precision matters when it comes to community finances. Our team ensures accurate accounting, detailed financial reporting, and reliable oversight to keep your community’s resources on track.. Request a Proposal Building Stronger Communities We believe every community should feel like home. Our team focuses on fostering relationships, enhancing communication, and creating a sense of belonging for all residents. Request a Proposal Why Associations Choose Us Clear Communication We prioritize open, consistent communication to keep boards and residents informed and confident in every decision. Regular updates and accessible support ensure no question goes unanswered. Clear, timely communication fosters trust and strengthens relationships within your community. Personalized Service Every community is unique, and our tailored approach ensures your association’s specific needs are met with care and attention. We build lasting partnerships by understanding and prioritizing your community's goals. Our proactive approach allows us to address challenges before they become problems, keeping your community running smoothly. Accurate Financial Management We ensure precise financial reporting and responsible oversight, keeping your community’s finances transparent and reliable. Our commitment to accuracy means you can trust every financial decision and report. Who We Are At Bedrock Association Management, we believe strong communities are built on trust, transparency, and dedicated leadership. We are more than just a management company—we are dedicated partners in building vibrant, well-managed communities. With a foundation built on expertise, integrity, and a passion for exceptional service, we deliver tailored solutions that address the unique needs of every association we serve. Our team combines years of experience in community management, financial oversight, and customer service to ensure seamless operations and lasting success. We believe that every homeowner deserves a well-managed community where they feel valued, heard, and truly at home. At Bedrock, “Making Communities Feel Like Home” isn’t just our slogan—it’s our commitment. Your Community Deserves the Best Management Experience Discover how Bedrock Association Management can make a difference in your community today. Learn More Featured Community Waterview Estates Owners Association, Inc. Richmond, TX Waterview Estates is a vibrant community of 1,171 homes , established in 2004 , offering exceptional amenities designed to enhance residents’ quality of life. The neighborhood features a large swimming pool with water features and a slide , a clubhouse , tennis courts , a splash pad , five pocket parks , miles of scenic walking trails , and three retention ponds that add to its natural beauty. Through a strong partnership with the MUD district, Waterview Estates benefits from a donation agreement and comprehensive parks plan. This collaboration has delivered significant value to the community without placing additional financial burdens on the HOA. The result? Increased property values, well-maintained common areas, and a stronger sense of community where every resident feels proud to call Waterview Estates home.
